title: Ticket #2554: IPv6 x86_64_rhap_6.1-updated Condor C tests fail. Is using ::1
remarks:
2011-Oct-20 14:56:49 by adesmet:
condor_status is being passed "-pool localhost". The /etc/hosts file maps localhost to BOTH 127.0.0.1 and ::1.

2011-Oct-21 17:33:23 by adesmet:
When using get_fqdn_and_ip_from_hostname() (which calls condor_getaddrinfo()) to find an IP address:
  1. It asks for all IP addresses, IPv4 and IPv4, not caring if IPv6 mode is enabled.
  2. It blinding takes the first one; in practice we would really need to test them all.

Immediate fix (being tested): change get_default_hint to only ask for IPv4 addresses if IPv6 mode isn't enable. Patch forthcoming.

Medium term consideration: should we bother filtering in get_fqdn_and_ip_from_hostname (/src/condor_utils/ipv6_hostname.cpp around line 207) to reject if ai_family isn't expected (AF_INET always and possibly AF_INET6)? Hopefully the fix above will ensure we never see them.

Long term fix: may need to track a list of IP addresses and try them in order. Likely to be a more involved and pervasive.

2011-Oct-31 12:43:41 by adesmet:
Short term solution in place.

2014-Jul-29 10:28:36 by adesmet:
Abandoned as old. Open a new ticket if re-observed.
